com.rexsl.maven.checks
Class DefaultChecksProvider

java.lang.Object
  com.rexsl.maven.checks.DefaultChecksProvider
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChecksProvider
public final class DefaultChecksProvider
extends Object
implements ChecksProvider

Provider of checks.

This class is NOT thread-safe.

Checks are executed in the order they are listed here.

BinaryFilesCheck

You shouldn't keep any binary files (images, video, etc.) in src/main/webapp folder and deploy them inside your WAR package. Instead, you should use some storage service (Amazon S3, for example) and a content delivery network (CDN) on top of it (Amazon CloudFront, for example). This check validates that no binary files are located inside src/main/webapp and complains if anything found.

JigsawCssCheck

All CSS stylesheets from src/main/webapp/css folder are sent to W3C Jigsaw validator. Any defect found will fail the build. Read more about this validation in Validator.

JSStaticCheck

JavaScript files from src/main/webapp/js are validated with YUI. This test is not implemented yet.

FilesStructureCheck

The following structure of directories and files is enforced inside src/main/webapp and src/test/rexsl (all of them should be present): 

 src/main/webapp
   /xsl
   /WEB-INF/web.xml
   /robots.txt
 src/test/rexsl
   /xml
   /scripts
   /xsd
   /xhtml

RexslFilesCheck

Test folders should contain files of certain types only: 

 src/test/rexsl
   /xml/*.xml
   /scripts/*.groovy
   /xsd/*.xsd
   /xhtml/*.groovy
   /bootstrap/*.groovy
   /setup/*.groovy

If any other types of files are found in these folders the check will complain and fail the build.

LibrariesCheck

The check verifies all libraries from target/.../WEB-INF/lib and finds conflicts between them.

XhtmlOutputCheck

XML pages from src/test/rexsl/xml are transformed to XHTML using XSL stylesheets attatched to them. Then, produced HTML pages are sent to W3C validator. And then, they are sent to designated groovy scripts from src/test/rexsl/xhtml. Name of Groovy script should be identical to the name of the XML page (except the extension, of course). Keep in mind that Groovy pre-compiles scripts to Java classes, that's why names should obey Java class naming rules.

Content of a created XHTML page is sent to the Groovy script in rexsl.document variable. It's very convenient to use XhtmlMatchers methods to assert certain XPath queries on the HTML documents.

InContainerScriptsCheck

The check starts an embedded Java Servlet container and runs Groovy scripts from src/test/rexsl/scripts, one by one. Scripts can use RestTester class to test the application through its RESTful interface. The URI of the running application is supplied in rexsl.home variable.

JSUnitTestsCheck

TBD...

WebXmlCheck

The check validates src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/web.xml XML file against its XSD schema and fails the build if any incosistencies are detected. Validation may take some time (15-45 seconds).

The class is thread-safe.

DefaultChecksProvider

public DefaultChecksProvider()
Method Detail

all

public Set<Check> all()
Get full collection of checks.

Checks should be ordered by their complexity. Most simple and fast checks should go first, in order to fail build faster. Most heavy and slow checks should be at the end of the list.

Specified by:
all in interface ChecksProvider
Returns:
List of checks
